article.headline: U.S. Physical Therapy's stock rallies as some furloughed employees return, clinics reopen
article.body: Shares of U.S. Physical Therapy Inc. USPH, -1.83% rallied 3.1% in morning trading Tuesday, after the operator of physical therapy clinics said about 300 furloughed employees have returned to work, as 10 of the clinics have reopened that the open clinics are now operating at about 70% of normal volumes. As the effects of the COVID-19 pandemic on business was at the worst in April, the company had closed about 70 clinics, or 12% of the total, and furloughed about 2,150 employees, or 40% of its workforce. In May, the company said patient volume was about 65% of normal, and it was able to generate an operating profit. The stock has hiked up 40.9% over the past three months, while the S&P 500 SPX, +0.87% has advanced 40.7%.
